home-public.en:
Please note this is an archive of events from PDC2022. All Conference events have now taken place. Registration or logins are not required to access Conference content

Welcome to the Participatory Design Conference 2022!

Our theme this year is Embracing Cosmologies: Expanding Worlds of Participatory Design.

Democratic and socially just practices of design have always foregrounded people as agents of socio-political change. In more recent years a growing recognition of other forms of participation beyond the human have emerged. These include participation not only from technological entities, such as AI and algorithms, but also participation with biophysical, ecological, and spiritual worlds. How we design equitably with these prescient entities is increasingly of concern for many participatory designers and researchers seeking to have meaningful impact.

Through invoking a hopeful design of social justice that responds to multiplicity and relational interdependence, the conference will explore what it means to embrace cosmological approaches to participatory design. This means valuing different kinds of participatory alliances that span micro-organisms to eco-systems, micro-finance to global supply chains and circular economies, algorithmic data justice for individuals and distributed communities.

Explore our detailed programme →

Explore our PDC Places programme →

A full day-by-day screen assisted version of the programme is available here.

programme-filters.en: Search for sessions that are interesting to you

places-filters.en: PDC is committed to embracing plurality and improving inclusivity, diversity and equitable participation within our community. We are also motivated to decrease the conference’s carbon footprint attributed to air travel, decentralising conference ownership and fostering local and international connectedness – especially in a time of a global pandemic that places great uncertainty around international travel and our ability to spend time physically together at a conference.

papers-filters.en: Filter to find the papers that interest you

newcastle.en:
Coming to Newcastle

We look forward to welcoming people to Newcastle upon Tyne on 30th August - 1st September.

Conference panels based on PDC papers, in-person keynotes and workshops will take place in Newcastle at the Urban Sciences Building at Newcastle University in the west of the City. (See where we are on a map).

Our Situated Actions and Exhibition will take place at Shieldfield Art Works; a community artists’ run centre in the east of the city.

Our Conference dinner will take place at Urban Green Cafe on the Town Moor, serving delicious locally sourced dishes with music.

On the 29th August (Bank Holiday Monday), we will be running a trip to Northumberland National Park. For more information about booking for this trip and further details on our social activities go to our Newcastle Social Page.

There are currently no Covid-19 restrictions for entering the UK from another country.

  • Register →

  • Travel to Newcastle →

  • Accommodation →

  • Newcastle social →

  • Newcastle map →

  • Covid guidance →

A full day-by-day screen assisted version of the programme is available here.

help.en:
Help!

Don’t panic! If you’re having problems with the scheduling platform, we will do our best to get you through it.

  1. Use our open access FAQ doc. We will keep updating this when we get new queries and problems. FAQ doc →

  2. If your problem isn’t listed on the FAQ doc you can send us a message either on Twitter or via email Twitter #PDCHelp →

  3. Email: help@pdc2022.org →

social.en:
Social

Keep up to date with what’s happening on our social media channels:

Coming to Newcastle

Geordie Dialect

Newcastle has its own dialect, Geordie if you fancy socialising with the locals!

Additional social events (not included in Conference fee)

Monday 29th August 11 am - 6pm

Northumberland National Park & Hadrian’s Wall

FULLY BOOKED

On Bank Holiday Monday, for those wishing to get further afield and out of the City, we have organised a day trip to The Sill, The UKs National Landscape Discovery Centre situated in the heart of the wild hills and unique geology of Northumberland’s National Park. This includes walks across Hadrian’s Wall, a UNESCO World Heritage site and accompanied by talks with local stewards of the landscape who work towards restoration and interpretation of the local area.

  • https://www.thesill.org.uk/

  • http://hadrianswallcountry.co.uk/

Conference events (included in Conference fee)

Tuesday 30th August 6-9 pm ****

Situated Actions & Exhibition Opening ****

Our situated actions and exhibition this year will take place at Shieldfield Art Works (SAW). The gallery and community arts space offers a unique location for sharing and experiencing participatory design and participatory art works in a converted church hosting a community library and an outdoor growing garden. Food and drink will be served by the Magic Hat Cafe, a zero-waste enterprise rescuing surplus food destined for landfill.

  • https://www.saw-newcastle.org/

  • http://www.themagichatcafe.co.uk/

Wednesday 31st August 6-10 pm

Conference Dinner

On Wednesday we will head over to Exhibition Park, next to the expansive inner city town moor where we will share locally sourced produce at Urban Green Cafe and listen to the energising music of Ladies of Midnight Blue.

  • https://urbangreennewcastle.org/urban-green-cafe/

  • https://www.hannabiell.com/ladies-of-midnight-blue.html

Explore Newcastle

If you’re here for a little longer take a look at newcastlegateshead.com.

We recommend trying …

City Centre

  • Great North Museum

  • Exhibition Park

  • Laing Gallery

  • Hatton Gallery

  • Discovery Museum

  • Newcastle Castle

Quayside

  • Baltic

  • Side Gallery

Ouseburn

  • Seven Stories

  • Ouseburn Farm

  • Victoria Tunnels

  • Biscuit Factory

Food and Drink

If you’re looking for good food try recommendations from https://newcastlegateshead.com/.

Read about Newcastle’s foodie scene and for local offers you can also find out more on our Geordie Street App.

We recommend trying …

City Centre

  • Grainger Market

  • Magic Hat Cafe

  • The Common Room

  • Wylam Brewery

Ouseburn

privacy.en:
Privacy Notice

We care about your privacy. This privacy notice applies to the PDC2022 websites developed and delivered by Open Lab, Newcastle University and University of Edinburgh (https://pdc2022.org and https://schedule.pdc2022.org)

Things you should know

When the Participatory Design Conference team collects information about you, the following describes how we handle that information.

We may receive personal information from you based on your interaction with us on social media platforms, booking forms and our existing Conference websites.

We may use cookies, GIFs, third party web analytics, device information, and IP addresses for functionality and to better understand user interaction with our products, services, and communications.

You can control individual cookie preferences, indicate your cookie preferences to others, and opt-out of web analytics and optimisation tools.

Our websites allow for Conference attendance and registration fees. These are handled by Newcastle University’s WebStore.

We collect your data to:

  • Administer your involvement in the PDC online and Newcastle face-to-face events

  • Make sure you have all the information you need throughout the Conference event

  • Evaluate and report on the impact and effectiveness of the event

We believe that the work we carry out to promote wider engagement and participation in the Conference is carried out in the wider PD community interest. Since we receive some funding from within Newcastle University and other funders, we need to ensure that this money is spent appropriately and has a positive impact. In order to measure impact and to conduct our activities, we need to collect your data. There is some essential data (name, email, place of work, country) required to complete your registration and without this we cannot register you for the Conference.

We ask for some data from you that is considered to be ‘special category data’ by data protection law. We ask for some accessibility and dietary information as part of your booking for the Conference. We are required under the Equality Act 2010 to ensure that we make any reasonable adjustments for participants to be able to fully participate in our online events and Newcastle University Campus as part of our in-person events. We also ask you to tell us your geographic location to ensure that we understand geographic representation and participation in all of our events and activities.

What we will use your data for

Your data will be used to stay in contact with you to ensure your full involvement in the relevant event or activity. Anonymised data will also be used for reporting, research, monitoring and evaluation purposes.

How we store your data

We will take all appropriate technical and organisational measures to keep your data secure. All data will be stored in accordance with data protection laws and other applicable legislation. Anonymised data will be archived and retained for research, monitoring and evaluation purposes.

If you withdraw from any of the activities or events provided by PDC or Newcastle University, please inform us if you do not want your data to be used. You can do this by emailing generalchairs@pdc2022.org

Who we share your data with

In order to ensure participation in the event, we will share limited data with the existing and future PDC organising team.

Sharing your data to evaluate and report on the impact of our events will not affect you individually. For all reporting purposes or Freedom of Information requests, your data will be aggregated and made anonymous. You will not be individually identified in any reports and confidentiality will be maintained at all times.

Your rights

You have the right to request that your data is removed from our system. Please contact the General Chairs if you wish to do this or if you have a query or complaint about the use of data. generalchairs@pdc2022.org

Please note, if would like to attend events online or in-person at Newcastle University campus you will need to provide us with some data in order for us to register your participation. You can, however, request that we do not share your data with any parties other than Newcastle University.

Under data protection law you are entitled to request copies of all the personal data. This is called a Subject Access Request. To make a request please follow the Newcastle University process set out at www.ncl.ac.uk/data.protection/accessyourpersonaldata/.

Details of your rights under the General Data Protection Regulation (GDPR) and how to contact the Information Commissioner’s Office can be found at www.ncl.ac.uk/data.protection/dataprotectionpolicy/privacynotice/. Our privacy policy is regularly updated www.ncl.ac.uk/schools/events/safety/data/.

Who to contact for more information

If you have any queries about your data please contact generalchairs@pdc2022.org  or contact Newcastle University Data Protection Officer www.ncl.ac.uk/data.protection/dataprotectionpolicy/privacynotice/

.

terms.en:
Terms and Conditions

Please read these terms and conditions before using the services offered by PDC2022, developed and delivered by Open Lab, University of Newcastle Upon Tyne (“PDC2022” “Open Lab, Newcastle University”, "Open Lab, University of Newcastle Upon Tyne", “we”, “us”). These Terms set the agreed conditions for your use of the websites https://pdc2022.org and https://schedule.pdc2022.org (the "Service") and the features, content, applications or widgets offered by Open Lab, Newcastle University (collectively with the Service, the "Service").

These Terms apply to all users, including, without limitation, users who are contributors of content, information, and other materials or services on the Service, individual users, venues that access the Service, and users that have a page on the Service. By using the Service you are agreeing to these Terms.

Registration

PDC2022 will include online, live and hybrid. Registration via the PDC website is for either online only or in-person attendance in Newcastle upon Tyne, which includes access to online events. If you are attending a Places in-person event, please contact the relevant organisers to check if there are additional fees involved. Places in-person events are costed and paid for separately.

Each ticket has a unique login, which allows for one person’s entry into the Conference. Keep your order details safe, as we may not be able to admit you to events if you do not have your login details. If you have not received login details please contact generalchairs@pdc2022.org

Refunds

Registration purchases are final and nonrefundable. However, if the event is cancelled by us, you will be entitled to a full refund of the amount paid for your order.

Ticket Transfers

Registration may be transferred to another person up to 10 working days before the event by emailing openlab-admin@ncl.ac.uk

Ticket assignees will be required to agree to these Terms in order to claim the ticket.

Participation and Removal

By participating in PDC, you agree to our Being Together Guide. These guidelines apply to participants, facilitators, wranglers, staff, volunteers, vendors, and anyone else involved in making the Conference possible.

By participating in the Conference we expect all those involved to be respectful and value each other’s ideas, styles and viewpoints.

We encourage people to be open, direct, generous and professional in your feedback and conversations; we cannot withhold hard truths.

We expect our team and participants to be inclusive and make space for new perspectives to be heard.

We want to make time to appreciate and accommodate our diverse cultural practices, attitudes and beliefs and facilitate openness to learning with others.

We want everyone to lead by example matching actions with words.

We will not tolerate violence and threats of violence; personal attacks; derogatory or hurtful language; unwelcome sexual attention or physical contact; disruptive behaviour; and the influencing of unacceptable behaviour.

If you do not respect these guidelines Conference organisers may take corrective action, including removing you and prohibiting further attendance If removed you will not receive any refund for tickets purchased.

Read our Being Together Guide.

Violations of the Being Together Guide may be reported by emailing generalchairs@pdc2022.org

Compliance with Third Party Platform Terms

PDC2022 utilises a number of third party services, such as Zoom, Miro and YouTube alongside social media channels. By taking part, you agree to comply with all terms governing the use of such services.

External Websites

PDC2022 websites may contain links to other websites or online services that are not under the control of or maintained by us. Once you have clicked on a link connecting you to any such third-party website or service, you will leave PDC2022 website and be taken to a website that we do not control. We are not responsible for the content of such third party websites or services. These Terms do not apply to such other websites and online services. We encourage you to review the privacy policies and terms of use of these other websites or services.

Attendee Privacy Notice

Our Privacy Notice describes how we handle information that we receive from you in connection with PDC2022.

Recordings

PDC2022 events, including paper and panel sessions and participation in social media discussions, may be recorded (for example, by video, photographic or audio recording) and published for access and use by PDC2022 participants or the general public. Please turn off your video and microphone on Zoom if you do not wish to be recorded. If you have any questions about recording of events, please contact us at generalchairs@pdc2022.org

Permission to Use Participant Content

PDC2022 includes opportunities for participants to contribute content, such as written or artistic works (“Submissions”). Some examples include workshops and Situated Actions, contributing to collaborative ideas, and session materials, such as Miro whiteboards. In addition, participants may engage in emergent sessions in which they may present materials such as slides, written works, photographs, videos, handouts, and other visual aids (“Session Materials”).

For Session Materials, you hereby grant PDC2022, its affiliates, and its licensees a nonexclusive, worldwide, sublicensable license to copy, use, distribute, publish, publicly display, and publicly perform the Session Materials (including Your likeness, photograph, name, voice, and biographical information if included in, or provided to PDC2022 in connection with, the Session Materials) for the purpose of making the Session Materials available to other PDC2022 participants, including through third party services (e.g. Zoom). If the Session Materials will be made available through a non-PDC2022 website (e.g. you post the Session Materials on your website or on YouTube or Vimeo), you grant PDC2022 the right to display a hyperlink to the Session Materials and such website (and any trademarks included in the hyperlink). You represent and warrant that you have the rights necessary to grant the rights granted herein, and further, that the uses contemplated under these Terms will not infringe the proprietary or intellectual property rights of any third party. You understand and agree that PDC2022 reserves the right, at its discretion, to review, modify, or remove any Session Materials that it deems is objectionable or in violation of these Terms.

For all other Submissions, you agree to the following in connection with each:

You hereby grant PDC2022 a nonexclusive, royalty-free, worldwide, sublicensable (to those we work with) license to use your Submission in connection with the online and offline promotion of PDC2022 mission.

If the Submission will be made available to PDC2022 through a non-PDC2022 website (e.g. you post it on your website or on YouTube or Vimeo), you grant PDC2022 the right to display a hyperlink to the Contribution and such website (and any trademarks included in the hyperlink) and/or embed the Submission on PDC2022’s websites and other channels.

You acknowledge that your Submissions may be accessible by other PDC2022 participants or the public.

You agree to license your Submissions in a manner that is compatible with the license(s) under which Mozilla makes material available to the public. Generally, PDC2022 uses the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International License, which provides that others may share and adapt the content on the condition that they provide attribution to the creator. For further details of the license, please read the license terms here: https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode. Publications published by ACM Proceedings can only be shared as pre-print versions if a License agreement has been signed by first authors. If authors have purchased an Open Access Agreement for their publications this can be shared openly.

You represent and warrant that you have the rights necessary to grant the rights granted herein, and further, that the uses contemplated under these Terms will not infringe the proprietary or intellectual property rights of any third party.

You understand and agree that PDC2022 reserves the right, at its discretion, to review, modify, or remove any Submission that it deems is objectionable or in violation of these Terms.

about.en:
About PDC 2022

Held biennially since 1990, the Participatory Design Conference (PDC) is an important venue for international discussion on the collaborative, social, and political dimensions of technology production and use. The Conference invites researchers and practitioners working on PD across multiple fields including; HCI (Human-Computer Interaction), CSCW (Computer Supported Cooperative Work), CSCL (Computer Supported Collaborative Learning), ICT4D (Information and Communication Technology for Development), Science and Technology Studies (STS), Social and Community Informatics, Development Studies, Media Studies, Anthropology, Sociology, Design, Architecture, Spatial planning, and Arts.

In 2022, the 17th Biennial PDC will be hosted in the UK for the first time in Newcastle upon Tyne. Due to the ongoing global Covid-19 pandemic, the conference will also be a globally distributed conference, with provision of online participation and by establishing multiple PDC Places, smaller gatherings of PD researchers and practitioners in different parts of the world.

  • Conference themes and calls →

  • Organising Committee →

  • Programme Committee →

calendar-help.en:
Calendar help

You can subscribe to your PDC 2022 My Schedule using your own calendar app, follow these instructions to get it up.

First go to your profile page and under Private Calendar click “Generate URL”. This will generate a unique URL that knows which events you have added to your My Schedule while browsing the full schedule. Copy this to your clipboard!

The next step depends on which calendar you use, we have guides for Apple’s Calendar, Google and Outlook.com.

Please note, your Private Calendar URL will only be active during the conference and 90 days after, after that it will expire.

Apple Calendar

On macOS, open the Calendar app:

On the iOS Calendar app:

Google Calendar

On your computer, go to Google Calendar website:

Outlook.com

Go to outlook.com and navigate to your calendar:
